about.summary: libraries and data formats that support array-oriented scientific data

name: libnetcdf
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "4.4.0" %}

package:
    name: libnetcdf
    version: {{ version }}

source:
    fn: v{{ version }}.tar.gz
    url: https://github.com/Unidata/netcdf-c/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
    md5: 4e3d3b05ab53d0ae6036a1a0fe1506e5

build:
    number: 2
    features:
        - vc9  # [win and py27]
        - vc10  # [win and py34]
        - vc14  # [win and py35]

requirements:
    build:
        - python  # [win]
        - cmake
        - pkg-config  # [unix]
        - msinttypes  # [win]
        - curl
        - zlib 1.2.*
        - hdf4
        - hdf5 1.8.17|1.8.17.*
    run:
        - curl
        - zlib 1.2.*
        - hdf4
        - hdf5 1.8.17|1.8.17.*

test:
    commands:
        - nc-config --all  # [unix]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.a  # [unix]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.so  # [linux]
        - test -f ${PREFIX}/lib/libnetcdf.dylib  # [osx]
        - conda inspect linkages -n _test libnetcdf  # [linux]

about:
    home: http://www.unidata.ucar.edu/software/netcdf/
    license: MIT
    summary: libraries and data formats that support array-oriented scientific data

extra:
    recipe-maintainers:
        - jakirkham
        - groutr
        - ocefpaf
